titleStmt.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to Frederick W. Seward, January 2, 1880

bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate Gen'l of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, Jan'y 2nd, '80
Mr. J. H. Smyth to Assistant Sec'y of State.
Returns and salary account for the 2nd Quarter, 1879, and annual returns for year 1879.

Consulate Gen'l of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, Jan'y 2nd, '80

I have the honor respectfully to return you the number of person from whom dispatches have been received during the second q'r '79, enclosure marked 1; also to whom, and the number of letters sent by me during said time, enclosure marked 2; also returns of arrivals and departures of American vessels during said time, enclosure marked 3; also, annual return of persons composing Legation for year 79, enclosure marked 4; also aggregate of
Hon. F. W. Seward,
Assistant Secretary,
Washington, D.C.
of fees for year '79, in which an error was made in footing of q'r ending Marc. 31, '79, which showed an excess of $5.43 more fees than had been collected, the amount having been doubled in my footing, and I respectfully show correction in my contingent a/c, enclosure marked 5; also, Treasury fees for said quarter, enclosure marked 6; also, fees on account of vessels, enclosure marked 7; also my salary account for said quarter with abstract of contingent expenses and vouchers, and voucher of loss of $3.21 by sale of draft, and for usual presents given menials, I have made no voucher as I deemed it unnecessary, the account
account, enclosure marked 8.

I am, Sir,
With highest considerations of esteem, Your obd't serv't,
Jno. H. Smyth,
U.S. Consul Gen'l

1 Dispatches rec'd
2 Letters sent
3 Return arrivals & departures, vessels
4 Annual return of persons at Legation
5 Annual return, fees
6 Treasury fees for Q'r
7 Fees on a/c vessels
8 Salary a/c & abstract contg't & voucher loss, exchange
P.S. A dispatch, consular series, date Dec 12 numbered 42 by mistake. Please correct & make it No. 43.
Names of persons employed at the United States Consulate at Monrovia, Liberia.

row.cell: Of What Country A Citizen or Subject.

div1.p:
Jno. H. Smyth,
U.S. Minister Resd't & Consul Gen'l
NOTE.–This Form should be sent to the Department always at the close of the year, in order that the printed list of consular officers may be corrected.
